Description: Small marl pottery lid, conical with pointed tip, which was pierced before firing with a small hole; coated with a buff slip and decorated on the exterior with faded red paint around the tip and edges, and on the interior with red pigment applied in an irregular manner.
Curator's comments: Illustrated in W.M.F Petrie and A.C. Mace, Diospolis Parva, London (1901), pl. xix.59m; Late ware L75m in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921). This is the lid for EA 30894 (from same tomb) and is made of the same fabric and has the same distinctive manner of decoration.
